DOC.brief_summary: Sugammadex is used as a reversal drug for rocuronium- or vecuronium-induced neuromuscular block during general anaesthesia. IV dexamethasone is injected as a prophylactic measure against postoperative nausea and vomiting. Recent animal data have shown that dexamethasone may impair the reversal effect of sugammadex. The objective of this randomised controlled trial is to confirm in the clinical practice these preliminary results.
DOC.brief_title: Impact of iv Dexamethasone on Reversal of Rocuronium-induced Neuromuscular Block by Sugammadex
DOC.criteria: patients scheduled to undergo microlaryngoscopy and earnosethroat endoscopic procedures contraindication to dexamethasone administration contraindication to sugammadex administration contraindication to rocuronium administration
